snippet.textDisplay: But didn't the composers say they wanted to make a soundtrack "inspired by" Michael Jackson? Even if he didn't have a direct hand in any of it (we'll never know, how can you be so certain it's a myth?), it seems they were at least trying to imitate his style.

snippet.textDisplay: As someone who now today listens to a lot of 80s Hi-NRG and Italo DIsco for some reason (I'm 19) I think I have this stuff to blame, the basslines and synths are a lot alike. The bass line in this track is a very classic Hi-NRG bass line.

snippet.textDisplay: @marioclub101 "Some" of it actually was. Brad Buxer (MJ's music partner & a credited composer for Sonic 3) confirmed in 2009 that "some" of MJ's work is still in the final game and that he & MJ themselves did the ending theme. Check it out & Michael Jackson's "Stranger in Moscow"! 😌😜😍
snippet.textOriginal: @marioclub101 "Some" of it actually was. Brad Buxer (MJ's music partner & a credited composer for Sonic 3) confirmed in 2009 that "some" of MJ's work is still in the final game and that he & MJ themselves did the ending theme. Check it out & Michael Jackson's "Stranger in Moscow"! 😌😜😍
